intro: Aster hookerianus, commonly known as Hooker's aster, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its showy blue to purple flower heads bloom in the summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Aster hookerianus is often found in open woods, meadows, and rocky habitats at elevations ranging from 1,500 to 3,000 meters.
